citation.article-title: Hymenobacter perfusus sp. nov., Hymenobacter flocculans sp. nov. and Hymenobacter metalli sp. nov. three new species isolated from an uranium mine waste water treatment system

p.s: Description of H. flocculans sp. nov.
id="par0105">H. flocculans (floc.cúlans. N.L. part. adj. flocculans, flocculating, referring to the organism's trait to flocculate in liquid cultures).
H. flocculans forms rod-shaped cells of variable length, 3–5 μm long and 0.5–0.8 μm wide.
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming and motility is not observed.
Colonies on R2A medium are red–pink pigmented and 0.5–1 mm in diameter after 48 h growth.
The optimum growth temperature is approximately 25 °C, and growth does not occur at 4 °C or 40 °C.
The optimum pH is 6.0–6.5, whereas growth does not occur at pH 5.0 or pH 10.0.
The major respiratory quinone is menaquinone 7.
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine (PE), two unknown aminophospholipid (APL2 and APL3), an unknown aminolipid (AL1) and an unknown polar lipid (L1).
The major fatty acids are 15:0 iso, 15:0 anteiso, 16:1 ω5c and summed feature 3 (16:1 ω6c and/or ω7c and/or 15:0 iso 2-OH).
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase test positive in API ZYM; other activities test negative.

Biolog GN2 tests show that strain A2-50AT oxidizes α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, Tween 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, d-galactose, d-mannose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, monomethyl succinate, α-, β- and γ-hydroxybutyric acids, malonic acid, sebacic acid, succinic acid, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine and d-glucose-6-phosphate; other substrates from this test are not oxidized by this strain.
Susceptible to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, rifampicin, tetracycline and vancomycin.
The DNA of strain A2-50AT has a G+C content of 63.4 mol% (HPLC method).
id="par0110">The type strain A2-50AT (=CIP 110139 = LMG 25699) was isolated from the water collected in Poço das Cobras (Urgeiriça mine), central Portugal.
